definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
while the connoisseur recognizes the artistry, the layman simply enjoys the show
pinyin: nei4 hang2 kan4 men2 dao5 , wai4 hang2 kan4 re4 nao5
containing_words.word: 内行看门道，外行看热闹

sentences.english: Dilettante watch the scene of bustle, adept guard the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 外行看热闹，内行看门道。

sentences.english: In the language of the layman the epicrustal rocks can best be described as the "scum" .
sentences.chinese: 用外行人的话来说，浅成岩最好称为“浮渣”。

sentences.english: We understand our business better than outsiders.
sentences.chinese: 我们比外行更理解我们的业务。

sentences.english: More than 270 so-called exoplanets have been found.
sentences.chinese: 至今为止被发现的外行星已经有超过270颗之多。

sentences.english: Risks that have seen a decline in importance are the ones that first come to mind for the layman.
sentences.chinese: 外行人首先会考虑风险重要性的降低程度。

sentences.english: Before 1991, scientists hadn't discovered a single exoplanet.
sentences.chinese: 1991年以前，科学家一个系外行星都还没发现。

sentences.english: But some exoplanets are wondrously Earth-like.
sentences.chinese: 但是其中有些系外行星与地球非常相似。

sentences.english: No, this is definitely an alien planet.
sentences.chinese: 不，这绝对是个地外行星。

sentences.english: I must admit I’m a layman as far as insurance is concerned.
sentences.chinese: 我得承认，就保险而言，我是个外行。

sentences.english: The other tests were designed to be given by laypeople.
sentences.chinese: 其他测试则是设计由外行人来执行的。

sentences.english: There are many definitions of art, few of which make much sense to the uninitiated.
sentences.chinese: 艺术有多种定义，外行人一般都难以理解。

sentences.english: In the language of the layman the Epicrustal rocks can best be described as the "scum. ""
sentences.chinese: 用外行人的话来说，浅成岩最好称为“浮渣”。

sentences.english: They think I am a greenhorn.
This kind of view is very dilettante.
sentences.chinese: 这种说法就是很外行的。

sentences.english: In order to study exoplanets, astronomers have had to be quite inventive.
sentences.chinese: 为了研究系外行星，天文学家必须非常有创造性。

sentences.english: This is looking more and more like a golden age of exoplanet discovery.
sentences.chinese: 这看起来越来越象一个探索系外行星的黄金时代。

definition: lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
different trades, worlds apart (idiom); to sb outside the profession, it is a closed book
slight knowledge of sth/superficial acquaintance with a subject/a smattering
lit. to know one and understand half (idiom); a smattering of knowledge/dilettante/amateur
switch to a job one was not trained for
experienced person/an old hand at sth
unable to make sense of what one is looking at
